name: Hinterland Orchards
role_in_state: Primary supplier of fruit, reagent plants and seasonal labor to coastal ports
economy_niches: stone-fruit and orchard produce (preserves, fresh export)
small-scale distillation (fruit spirits, oils) for ritual and trade
seasonal labor export (harvest crews to ports)
cartage and riverine transport of bulky goods
culture_adjustments: land-tenured, family-run orchard households rather than guild dominance
seasonal harvest calendar and festivals override maritime rhythms
oral lore emphasizes ancestor stewardship over sea-shanty tradition
trading argot simplified toward Coastal Tongues with fewer Island Creole forms
practical skepticism of navigational auguries; reliance on soil-rituals for fertility
constraints: limited access to imported ritual reagents; dependent on coastal redistribution
poor roads and river bottlenecks raise transport costs
notes: bulk, low-margin goods; political leverage tied to seasonal labor flows
local distillation produces partial substitutes for some imported reagents
